example[0]: Briggs found himself at odds with his colleagues.
example[1]: The two politicians were at odds over what was the truth.
definition[1]: if two statements, descriptions, actions etc are at odds with each other, they are different although they should be the same
example[2]: Mark’s account of what happened is at odds with Dan’s.
example[3]: She gave him a sweet smile, totally at odds with the look of dislike in her eyes.
